intro: Gynura annua, commonly known as the stinging nettle or Chinese nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its opposite, heart-shaped leaves with fine, stinging hairs. The plant produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Gynura annua is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
